page.title: 20SOUTH FARNHAM MIDDLE SCHOOL
page.content: The building was first opened as a Girls Grammar school in 1937 but after reorganising of Surrey schools it reopened as a Middle School in 1974. There are about 320 children,aged between 8 and 12 years, on roll.The school is divided into four year groups with three or four classes in each year.Some children come by coach but the majority either walk or come by car.There are several specialist rooms for science ,home economics, craft,music and there is a well equipped gymnasium,a library, hall and stage as well as 11 classrooms. There is a large playing field and two hard court areas.Some children go to Farnham Leisure Centre for swimming lessons. The school colours are blue and grey and most children wear school uniform in these colours with a blue and gold striped tie.
